DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the investigators study is to compare in children aged less than 18 months and hospitalized for an acute viral bronchiolitis the efficacy of the HS 3% (Mucoclear®, sterile ampoules of 4 ml) nebulised with a conventional jet-nebulizer (particles diameter of 4-5 µm), or with a jet-nebulizer adapted for infants (particles diameter of 2-2.5 µm), or with a mesh-nebulizer adapted for infants (particles diameter of 2-2.5 µm).
DOC.brief_title: Influence of the Nebulizer on the Clinical Efficacy of Hypertonic Saline 3% in Children Aged Less Than 18 Months and Hospitalized With Acute Viral Bronchiolitis

This clinical score, described by Wang in 1992, is the clinical score classically used in the studies concerning the acute(sharp) bronchiolitis of the infant ( 8,9,12 ).
